quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Capital and State
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, augusta, halleys. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Guthrie was once the state capital of Oklahoma.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Name the first woman to get a doctorate in mathematics.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sophia Kovalevskaya

questions.question: Which state capital also served as a capital of the Confederate States of America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richmond

questions.question: In 2007, what city was the most populous state capital in the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phoenix

questions.question: Who played Vivian in the romantic comedy movie Pretty Woman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julia Roberts

questions.question: What is the southern most state in the USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hawaii

questions.question: Which famous person was both born and died in years, when Halleys Comet was visible?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Samuel Clemens

questions.question: Cheyenne has served as the state capital of Wyoming since Wyoming established its statehood in 1890.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Houston once served as the state capital of Texas.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is Vivians surname in the film Pretty Woman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ward

questions.question: What is the capital of New York State?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albany

questions.question: Which was the capital city of the Persian Empire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ecbatana

questions.question: Augusta is the capital of which state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maine

questions.question: In which direction does the Nile river flow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South to North

questions.question: Which city serves as the state capital of California?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sacramento

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Pretty Woman and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, world, al. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: My predecessor, Blue Ribbon Sports, was incorporated in 1964. My name came from the Greek goddess for victory. Would that mean I am Nike, Inc.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Who helps Vivian, the main character in Pretty Woman, pick out a dress for dinner?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bridget

questions.question: Who played the financial tycoon Edward Lewis in the popular movie Pretty Woman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Gere

questions.question: In Pretty Woman Edward pays Vivian $4,000 to stay for the whole week.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the movie Pretty Woman Vivian finds Kit drunk in which bar?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Blue Banana

questions.question: In the movie Pretty Woman Edward and Vivian go to see which opera?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: La Traviata

questions.question: I own the Microsoft Corporation. You may know me as one of the richest men in the world. Am I Warren Buffett?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Ata Maivia from Samoa is the mother of this celebrity, who was born on May 2, 1972.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rock

questions.question: What do Vivian and Edward order from room service in the movie Pretty Woman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: strawberries and champagne

questions.question: I am on the ABC channel. William Shatner plays Denny Crane and Candice Bergen plays Shirley Schmidt in me. Am I the Knights of Prosperity TV series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: What sport do Vivian and Edward watch in Pretty Woman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Polo

questions.question: In the movie Pretty Woman, what was the name of Vivians friend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kit

questions.question: Lucille Jeter was sixteen when she met Al, the father of this famous musician, who in his early career, used the stage name Maurice James.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimi Hendrix

questions.question: This eccentric British musician, often called the chameleon of pop, is the son of Haywood Stenton Jones and Margaret Burns.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Bowie

questions.question: This actress, who won an Academy Award in 1998, is the daughter of Tony Award winner Blythe Danner.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gwyneth Paltrow

questions.question: This epic poem follows the voyage of the king of Ithaca, who returns from the Trojan War.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Whoopi Goldberg and Actress
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, goldbergs, poet. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Whoopi Goldbergs first big part was in the 1985 movie The Color Purple. What role did she play?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Celie

questions.question: In which city was Whoopi Goldberg born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York City

questions.question: Name the famous director who discovered Whoopi Goldberg.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Nichols

questions.question: Whoopi Goldberg was inspired to become an actress by watching the performance of this actress.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nichelle Nichols

questions.question: Whoopi Goldberg was very influential in developing Comic Relief  around 1986. Who were the other two  comedians who helped develop Comic Relief?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robin Williams and Billy Crystal

questions.question: What tattoo does Whoopi Goldberg have on her shoulder?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Woodstock

questions.question: This Arab poetess was born in 1001 in the family of the Caliph of Cordova. After the death of her father, she inherited a tremendous wealth, which helped her to open a salon for writers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walladah Al-Mustakfi

questions.question: What statement is true about Whoopi Goldbergs first husband?

options.text: He was Whoopis drug treatment counselor.
He was Whoopis first drama coach.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was Whoopis drug treatment counselor.

questions.question: How did Whoopi Goldberg get the name Whoopi?

options.text: It was given to her by her mother.
Her first agent  made up the name.
She made it up and used it because it was interesting.
Her friends called her Whoopi because of her flatulence.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Her friends called her Whoopi because of her flatulence.

questions.question: This female poet lived between 630 and 612 BC on the island of Lesbos in Greece. She was considered a lyricist because the poems she wrote were to be performed with the accompaniment of a lyre.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sappho

questions.question: Whoopi Goldberg was the second African-American actress to win an Oscar. Who was the first?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hattie McDaniels

questions.question: Whoopi Goldberg was the first woman to host the Oscars.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 2001, Oscar-winning actress Whoopi Goldberg starred in Rat Race, the first movie that featured two Oscar-winning African-Americans. Who was the other award -winning actor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cuba Gooding, Jr.

questions.question: What statement regarding Whoopi Goldberg is not true?

options.text: She hates flying so she tries to bus whenever she can.
She is a former heroin addict.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She has one eyebrow.

questions.question: This 1999 film, directed by Anthony Minghella, stars Matt Damon as a homosexual psychopath.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Talented Mr. Ripley

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Nba and Author
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, rookie, committee. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This female author became famous for her poems devoted to her husband Robert, who was also a famed poet. She met him at the age of 39.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth Browning

questions.question: This basketball player and his teammates Glenn Robinson and Ray Allen formed the Milwaukee Bucks Big Three in the period between 1999 and 2003 .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sam Cassell

questions.question: When this NBA player was a rookie at the Denver Nuggets, he asked Michael Jordan to make a free throw with his eyes closed. Jordan did it, nailed the shot and told him Welcome to NBA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dikembe Mutombo

questions.question: In 1995, this professional basketball player, nicknamed The Big Ticket and The Kid was drafted out of high school to Minnesota Timberwolves.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kevin Garnett

questions.question: She is one of Russias greatest poetesses of the 20th century. Her real name was Anna Gorenko but she adopted a pen name because of her father. He was afraid that a poetess would bring shame to the family.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anna Akhmatova

questions.question: This author was a convinced vegetarian. That is why her most famous character - Frankenstein is also a vegetarian.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Shelley

questions.question: Which NBA star was elected president of the Executive Committee of National Basketball Player Association in 2004?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antonio Davis

questions.question: This author was devoted to the antislavery campaign. She wanted to do something to help this cause and one day, while in church, she decided to write a novel about slavery. Today this is her most famous work.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harriet Beecher Stowe

questions.question: This lady is a famous English novelist. Her first novel Northanger Abbey was published posthumously.  In addition, 100 years after her death, 3 volumes of her juvenilia were also published.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jane Austen

questions.question: Which NBA star, famous for taking part in a Sprite commercial, was granted the 2004-2005 NBA Sportsmanship Award for his sportsmanship, ethical behavior, fair play and integrity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grant Hill

questions.question: When her family discovered her poetic talent, they urged this English author and her two sisters to publish a collective volume of their works. The sisters used male pen names, as there were prejudices against female authors at the time. Later, she published her only novel Wuthering Heights, which became a literary classic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emily Bronte

questions.question: This is one of Latin Americas foremost writers. She is considered to be one of the initiators of Latin American feminist literary awakening. She has a special tradition of her own - to start every new book on January 8th .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isabel Allende

questions.question: Who was the first Cleveland Cavalier player to get the prize NBA Rookie of the year in 2004, when he was only 19?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lebron James

questions.question: Which NBA star was charged with sexual assault on a 19-year old hotel employee in the summer of 2003?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kobe Bryant

questions.question: Which famous NBA player, founder of the Stand Tall Foundation, was selected by the Milwaukee Bucks in the 1993 NBA Draft.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vin Baker
